channel.title: Couple questions about 718
channel.description:
So I got an email from a rsps forum saying my password was out of date by 2200 days and decided to get back into it.... Ive decided to host one 317 and one 718 but im pretty rusty, Im moving along smoothly with the 317 mostly from memory but the 718s giving me some problems. I decided on the matrix 718 client because it seems the most stock as far as I can tell? Is this generally considered a good client, if not opinions are welcome? If its decent, Im working on converting it to a web client but the code that handles the cache is a headache of obfuscation, can anyone provide me with information about how the 718 loads the cache? Ive deleted all of my local caches and it seems to pull some from the server but I cant find the code where it does to modify it to pull from my FTP instead. And uh... any other tips, tricks, comments about 718s/clients in general/.. anything are welcome very much,
Thanks Hiaburi
As an afterthought. Does anyone know why I cant use my public domain name to connect to a server on my local network? Its a bit annoying trying to test code when my helper has to recompile the client every time I change it because he has to use my domain name...

item.title: Couple questions about 718
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

So I got an email from a rsps forum saying my password was out of date by 2200 days and decided to get back into it… Ive decided to host one 317 and one 718 but im pretty rusty, Im moving along smoothly with the 317 mostly from memory but the 718s giving me some problems. Ive deleted all of my local caches and it seems to pull some from the server but I cant find the code where it does to modify it to pull from my FTP instead. And uh… any other tips, tricks, comments about 718s/clients in general/… anything are welcome very much,

Thanks
